designSystem.name: Modern Dashboard Design System
designSystem.description: A clean, minimalist design system with dark gray backgrounds, light gray cards, and red accents. Optimized for modern web applications with a focus on clarity and user experience.

designPrinciples.clarity: Every element should have clear purpose and hierarchy. Information should be scannable and digestible.
designPrinciples.consistency: Reusable components maintain visual consistency across the application.
designPrinciples.minimalism: Clean, uncluttered interfaces with generous white space. Avoid unnecessary decorative elements.
designPrinciples.accessibility: High contrast ratios, clear typography hierarchy, and touch-friendly interactive elements.
designPrinciples.modernity: Contemporary design with rounded corners, soft shadows, and smooth interactions.

background.description: Dark gray background - the main canvas color for the entire application
background.usage: Primary background for pages, dashboards, and main content areas

accent.description: Red accent color - used for progress indicators, active states, and primary actions
accent.usage: Progress bars, toggle switches (active), interactive highlights, and brand elements

white.description: Light gray for card backgrounds and content containers
white.usage: Card backgrounds, modal backgrounds, input fields

black.description: Pure black for primary text and high-contrast elements
black.usage: Main headings, body text, important labels

light.description: Light gray for borders, dividers, and subtle backgrounds
light.usage: Card borders, input borders, disabled states

medium.description: Medium gray for secondary text and inactive elements
medium.usage: Secondary text, placeholder text, inactive dates in calendar

dark.description: Dark gray for tertiary text and subtle emphasis

success.description: Green for success states, positive actions, and accept buttons
success.usage: Success messages, accept buttons, positive indicators

error.description: Red for errors, destructive actions, and deny buttons
error.usage: Error messages, deny buttons, destructive actions

warning.description: Orange/amber for warnings and caution states

info.description: Blue for informational messages and neutral actions

fontFamily.primary: Inter, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, sans-serif
fontFamily.description: Modern, clean sans-serif font family. Inter is preferred for its excellent readability and modern aesthetic.

display.usage: Large profile names, major headings, hero text

heading1.usage: Card titles, section headings, project names

hierarchy.primary: Use display or heading1 for the most important information (e.g., user names, project titles)
hierarchy.secondary: Use heading2 or heading3 for supporting information (e.g., job titles, section headers)
hierarchy.tertiary: Use body or bodySmall for descriptions and general content
hierarchy.metadata: Use caption or bodySmall for timestamps, labels, and less important information

borderRadius.description: Rounded corners are a key design element. Cards use 'lg' (0.75rem), buttons use 'md' (0.5rem), and avatars use 'full' (circular).

shadows.description: Subtle shadows for depth. Cards use 'md' shadow to create elevation without being heavy.

card.description: Primary container component for all content sections

variants.default: Light gray background with subtle shadow

layout.spacing: Maintain 1.5rem gap between cards in grid layouts
layout.padding: Always use 1.5rem internal padding for card content

button.description: Interactive action elements with clear visual hierarchy

primary.description: Success green button for primary positive actions (Accept, Confirm) - uses semantic success color

secondary.description: Gray button for secondary actions (Deny, Cancel)

tertiary.description: Dark gray button with red text for tertiary actions (View all, View details)

states.hover: Slightly darker shade of base color
states.active: Even darker, with slight scale transform (0.98)
states.disabled: Reduced opacity (0.5) and no pointer events

avatar.description: Circular profile pictures for users and team members

grouping.overlap: When displaying multiple avatars, overlap by -0.5rem to show relationships
grouping.maxVisible: Show 4-5 avatars, then indicate remaining count with a badge

progressIndicator.description: Circular progress bars showing completion percentage
progressIndicator.usage: Display in top-left or top-right of cards to show project/task completion

badge.description: Small colored pills for labels, counts, and status indicators

calendar.description: Date picker and calendar display component

notification.description: Individual notification items in a list

input.description: Form input fields and text areas

menu.description: Three-dot menu icon for additional actions
menu.position: Top-right corner of cards and components

grid.description: Responsive grid system for card layouts

hover.description: Subtle hover effects on interactive elements

active.description: Pressed state for buttons and interactive elements

profileCard.structure: Avatar (large, centered) → Name (display size) → Title (body small) → Tags (badges) → Menu icon (top-right)
profileCard.spacing: Avatar: 1rem bottom margin, Name: 0.5rem bottom margin, Tags: 1rem top margin with 0.5rem gap between

projectCard.structure: Progress indicator (top-left) → Title (heading1) → Description (body, truncated) → Team avatars (bottom) → Menu icon (top-right)
projectCard.spacing: Progress: absolute positioned, Title: 1rem top margin, Description: 0.75rem top margin, Avatars: 1rem top margin

notificationCard.structure: Header (title + badge) → Notification list → Action buttons (bottom)
notificationCard.spacing: Header: 1rem bottom margin, Notifications: no gap (bordered), Actions: 1rem top margin with gap

informationArchitecture.hierarchy: Most important information (names, titles) at top, supporting information (descriptions, metadata) below, actions at bottom
informationArchitecture.grouping: Related information grouped together with consistent spacing
informationArchitecture.alignment: Left-aligned text for readability, centered for avatars and circular elements

contrast.minimum: 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text
contrast.description: Ensure all text meets WCAG AA contrast requirements

touchTargets.description: All interactive elements should be at least 44x44 pixels for comfortable touch interaction

focus.visible: All interactive elements must have visible focus states

guidelines.useTailwind: Prefer Tailwind CSS utility classes for styling. Extend tailwind.config.js with custom colors and spacing from this design system.
guidelines.componentStructure: Create reusable components for each UI element (Card, Button, Avatar, etc.) that follow these specifications.
guidelines.responsiveDesign: All components should be mobile-first and responsive using the grid breakpoints defined above.
guidelines.consistency: Always use the spacing scale, color palette, and typography scale defined here. Avoid arbitrary values.
guidelines.stateManagement: Ensure all interactive elements have hover, active, focus, and disabled states as specified.

tailwindMapping.spacing: Use Tailwind's spacing scale (p-4 = 1rem, p-6 = 1.5rem, etc.)
